verses.text: Then all Israel gathered themselves to David unto Hebron , saying , Behold, we \add are\add* thy bone and thy flesh.

And moreover in time past , even when Saul was king , thou \add wast\add* he that leddest out and broughtest in Israel : and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God said unto thee, Thou shalt feed my people Israel , and thou shalt be ruler over my people Israel.\f + \fr 11.2 \ft in time…: Heb. both yesterday and the third day\f*\f + \fr 11.2 \ft feed: or, rule\f*

Therefore came all the elders of Israel to the king to Hebron ; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; and they anointed David king over Israel , according to the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* by Samuel.  +  r 11.3  t by: Heb. by the hand of * \p
¶ And David and all Israel went to Jerusalem , which \add is\add* Jebus ; where the Jebusites \add were\add*, the inhabitants of the land.
And the inhabitants of Jebus said to David , Thou shalt not come hither. Nevertheless David took the castle of Zion , which \add is\add* the city of David.
And David said , Whosoever smiteth the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain. So Joab the son of Zeruiah went first up , and was chief.\f + \fr 11.6 \ft chief: Heb. head\f*
And David dwelt in the castle ; therefore they called it the city of David.\f + \fr 11.7 \ft it: that is, Zion\f*
And he built the city round about , even from Millo round about : and Joab repaired the rest of the city.\f + \fr 11.8 \ft repaired: Heb. revived\f*
So David waxed greater and greater : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts \add was\add* with him.\f + \fr 11.9 \ft waxed…: Heb. went in going and increasing\f* \p

¶ These also \add are\add* the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who strengthened themselves with him in his kingdom , \add and\add* with all Israel , to make him king , according to the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* concerning Israel.\f + \fr 11.10 \ft strengthened…: or, held strongly with him\f*

And this \add is\add* the number of the mighty men whom David had; Jashobeam , an Hachmonite , the chief of the captains : he lifted up his spear against three hundred slain \add by him\add* at one time.\f + \fr 11.11 \ft an Hachmonite: or, son of Hachmoni\f*
And after him \add was\add* Eleazar the son of Dodo , the Ahohite , who \add was one\add* of the three mighties.

He was with David at Pas-dammim , and there the Philistines were gathered together to battle , where was a parcel of ground full of barley ; and the people fled from before the Philistines.\f + \fr 11.13 \ft Pas-dammim: also called, Ephes-dammim\f*

And they set themselves in the midst of \add that\add* parcel , and delivered it, and slew the Philistines ; and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* saved \add them\add* by a great deliverance.\f + \fr 11.14 \ft set…: or, stood\f*\f + \fr 11.14 \ft deliverance: or, salvation\f* \p

¶ Now three of the thirty captains went down to the rock to David , into the cave of Adullam ; and the host of the Philistines encamped in the valley of Rephaim.\f + \fr 11.15 \ft three…: or, three captains over the thirty\f*
And David \add was\add* then in the hold , and the Philistines’ garrison \add was\add* then at Beth-lehem.
And David longed , and said , Oh that one would give me drink of the water of the well of Beth-lehem , that \add is\add* at the gate !

And the three brake through the host of the Philistines , and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem , that \add was\add* by the gate , and took \add it\add*, and brought \add it\add* to David : but David would not drink \add of\add* it, but poured it out to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*,

And said , My God forbid it me, that I should do this thing : shall I drink the blood of these men that have put their lives in jeopardy ? for with \add the jeopardy of\add* their lives they brought it. Therefore he would not drink it. These things did these three mightiest.\f + \fr 11.19 \ft that have…: Heb. with their lives?\f* \p
¶ And Abishai the brother of Joab , he was chief of the three : for lifting up his spear against three hundred , he slew \add them\add*, and had a name among the three.
Of the three , he was more honourable than the two ; for he was their captain : howbeit he attained not to the \add first\add* three.

Benaiah the son of Jehoiada , the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel , who had done many acts ; he slew two lionlike men of Moab : also he went down and slew a lion in a pit in a snowy day.\f + \fr 11.22 \ft who had…: Heb. great of deeds\f*

And he slew an Egyptian , a man of \add great\add* stature , five cubits high; and in the Egyptian’s hand \add was\add* a spear like a weaver’s beam ; and he went down to him with a staff , and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand , and slew him with his own spear.\f + \fr 11.23 \ft great…: Heb. measure\f*
These \add things\add* did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada , and had the name among the three mighties.
Behold , he was honourable among the thirty , but attained not to the \add first\add* three : and David set him over his guard. \p
¶ Also the valiant men of the armies \add were\add*, Asahel the brother of Joab , Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem ,
Shammoth the Harorite , Helez the Pelonite ,\f + \fr 11.27 \ft Shammoth: or, Shammah\f*\f + \fr 11.27 \ft Harorite: or, Harodite\f*\f + \fr 11.27 \ft Pelonite: or, Paltite\f*
Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite , Abi-ezer the Antothite ,
Sibbecai the Hushathite , Ilai the Ahohite ,\f + \fr 11.29 \ft Sibbecai: or, Mebunnai\f*\f + \fr 11.29 \ft Ilai: or, Zalmon\f*
Maharai the Netophathite , Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite ,\f + \fr 11.30 \ft Heled: or, Heleb\f*
Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah , \add that pertained\add* to the children of Benjamin , Benaiah the Pirathonite ,
Hurai of the brooks of Gaash , Abiel the Arbathite ,\f + \fr 11.32 \ft Hurai: or, Hiddai\f*\f + \fr 11.32 \ft Abiel: or, Abi-albon\f*
Azmaveth the Baharumite , Eliahba the Shaalbonite ,
The sons of Hashem the Gizonite , Jonathan the son of Shage the Hararite ,\f + \fr 11.34 \ft Hashem: or, Jashen\f*
Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite , Eliphal the son of Ur ,\f + \fr 11.35 \ft Sacar: or, Sharar\f*\f + \fr 11.35 \ft Eliphal: or, Eliphelet\f*\f + \fr 11.35 \ft Ur: or, Ahasbai\f*
Hepher the Mecherathite , Ahijah the Pelonite ,
Hezro the Carmelite , Naarai the son of Ezbai ,\f + \fr 11.37 \ft Hezro: or Hezrai\f*\f + \fr 11.37 \ft Naarai: or Paarai the Arbite\f*
Joel the brother of Nathan , Mibhar the son of Haggeri ,\f + \fr 11.38 \ft the son…: or, the Haggerite\f*
Zelek the Ammonite , Naharai the Berothite , the armourbearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah ,
Ira the Ithrite , Gareb the Ithrite ,
Uriah the Hittite , Zabad the son of Ahlai ,
Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite , a captain of the Reubenites , and thirty with him,
Hanan the son of Maachah , and Joshaphat the Mithnite ,
Uzzia the Ashterathite , Shama and Jehiel the sons of Hothan the Aroerite ,
Jediael the son of Shimri , and Joha his brother , the Tizite ,\f + \fr 11.45 \ft son…: or, Shimrite\f*
Eliel the Mahavite , and Jeribai , and Joshaviah , the sons of Elnaam , and Ithmah the Moabite ,
Eliel , and Obed , and Jasiel the Mesobaite.
